title: Introduction
text: Clustergrammer is a visualization library built using D3.js that enables intuitive interaction with high-dimensional data.
Clustergrammer was built with biological data in mind and this example shows kinase gene expression levels obtained from the CCLE.
Scroll down to take an interactive tour.

title: Zooming and Panning
text: Zoom and pan into large datasetsby scrolling and dragging.

title: Reordering using buttons
text: Rows and columns can be reordered using the buttons on the sidebar.
Here rows are ordered based on their variance.

title: More reordering
text: You can also reorder the matrix based on the data in a single row/column or category by double-clicking its label.
Here columns are ordered based on the data in the EGFR row.
Try double-clicking a row/column label or category label to reorder.

title: Dendrograms
text: Row and column dendrograms are shown when in clustered order. The dendrogram shows groups at different hierarchical levels and sliders can be used to change group sizes.
Clicking on a dendrogram group allows you to export the row/column names in the group. Pressing Shift while clicking filters the matrix and only shows the group data.

title: Row Search Descriptions
text: You can search for a row using the search box. This can be useful if you are working with a large matrix.
Hovering over a row gene symbol automatically brings up the full gene name and description obtained from the Harmonizome

title: Filter rows
text: Filtering your data to reduce dimensionality can be useful for investegating complex datasets.
Clustergrammer allows you to filter your rows based on their sum or variance - here we are filtering for the top 10 rows based on variance.

title: Enrichr Menu
text: Users can run enrichment analysis on their genes (where genes are rows) using Enrichr.
Clicking the Enrichr logo brings up an Enrichr menu with a list of available libraries.
Scroll down to run an example enrichment or click a library.

title: Run Enrichr
text: Clicking on the ChEA 2015 library sends your gene list to Enrichr and resturns the top 10 enriched transcription factors as row categories.
You can send subsets of gene lists to Enrichr using the dendrogram to select subsets of genes.

title: Clear Categories
text: You can clear your results by opening the Enrichr menu and clicking 'Clear Results'

title: Conclusion
text: Clustergrammer enables intuitive exploration of high-dimensional biological data and allows users to gain insights through integration of prior biological knowledge (e.g. enrichment analysis).
Clustergrammer is an open source project available on GitHub. Clustergrammer can be used as a web app and as a Jupyter/IPython widget.
